316415-d-11-13-04-GTW.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING A CUT OF 11 CARS INTO TRACK GT 14 WHEN LEADING CAR, TTGX913819 DERAILED OFF THE ENDOF THE STUB TRACK, STRIKING AND DERAILING 3 CARS ON ADJACENT TRACK GT13.  TRACKS ARE LEASED BY TRANSCO RAILWAY INC AND ARE IN POOR CONDITION.  DUE TO OVERGROWN FOLIAGE, POOR TRACK CONDITIONS AND HAZARDOUS WALKING CONDITIONS AT THIS FACILITY, CREW ARE INSTRUCTED NOT TO RIDE RAIL CARS INTO TRACKS ATTHE FACILITY.  IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE 12 CARS ON TRACK GT14 WHEN THE 11 CARS WERE ADDED.  THIS RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT ON THE NORTH END OF THE TRACK.  WHEN THESE CARS DERAILED, THEY STRUCK 3 CARS IN CURVE ON TRACK GT13.

04007-d-11-16-04-GVSR.Narrative: THE UNION PACIFIC SHOWS THE DERAILMENT CAUSE TO BE " M203 OVERLOADED CAR."  WE FIND NO EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THE CLAIM OF AN OVERLOADED CAR.  THE CARS WERE LOADED WITH UREA AND THE CERTIFIED WEIGHTS OBTAINED FROM GALVESTON BULK TERMINAL, INC., WHERE THE CARS WERE LOADED CLEARLY SHOW THE CARS TO BE LOADED WITHIN THE LOAD LIMITS OF THE CARS.  UP HAS NOT PROVIDED ANY CERTIFIED WEIGHTS SHOWING THE CARSWERE OVERLOADED.  OUR INVESTIGATION OF THE ACCIDENT SHOWS A WORN SWITCH POINT AND POSSIBLE PUMPING IN THE AREA OF THE SWITCH TO HAVE BEEN THE CAUSE OF DERAILMENT.  THE WHEEL JUST PAST THE SWITCH POINTIN QUESTION WAS FOUND TO HAVE CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT JUST AS THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED (SEE ATTACHED PHOTOS).

316757-d-11-21-04-IC.Narrative: IHB MAKING DELIVERY WAS INSTRUCTED TO SET OUT ON TRACK 3.  IHB CONDUCTOR TOOK TAXI TO LINE UP SWITCHES TO TRACK 3, BUT FAILED TO LINE NORTH END OF 7 POCKET, THEN GOT BACK IN CAB AND WENT TO SOUTH TO PROTECT SHOVE.  CREW THEN SHOVED UP FROM IHB WITHOUT MAN ON LEADING CAR INTO 7 POCKET, STRIKING TWO BNSF LOCOMOTIVES.  THEY CONTINUED SOUTH AND RAN THROUGH THE SOUTH END OF 7 POCKET SWITCH ABOUT 40 CARLENGTHS BEFORE CONDUCTOR DISCOVERED THEY WERE ON THE WRONG TRACK.  MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED AND REVERSED RESULTING IN DERAILMENT OF FOUR LOADED MULTILEVELS AT THE SOUTH END OF 7 POCKET AT THE SWITCH THEYHAD JUST RUN THROUGH.

THE CREW MEMBERSFAILED TO ASCERTAIN THAT THE EAST END OF THE XOVER WAS PROPERLY LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT.  WHEN THE ENGINE REACHED THE EAST END OF THE XOVER, THEY WENT THROUGH IT AND INTO THE SIDEOF THEIR TRAIN.

188521-d-11-07-04-SOO.Narrative: CN CREW HAD JUST FINISHED DOUBLING UP 88 EMPTIES OFF 3 TRACKS IN STINSON YARD. AS THEY SHOVED BACK INTO TRACK #9 (TO CLEAR STINSON AVENUE), THE 13, 14, 15, AND 16TH CARS DERAILED. RECEIVED INFORMATIONFROM CITI ON 4/17/06 THAT THE CN HAD SUBMITTED LATE FORM 54 REPORTING AS FRA REPORTABLE WITH EQUIPMENT REPAIR COSTS OF $5,180.00 WHEN ADDED TO OUR TRACK REPAIR COSTS OF $2,385.41 THIS MEETS FRA REPORTING THRESHOLD. AS OF 3/22/06 OUR EQUIPMENT COSTS WERE SHOWING $3,704.00 WITH QUESTION TO CN IF THESE WERE ACCURATE, BUT NO RESPONSE WAS EVER RECEIVED FROM CN. PER CN CAUSE UNDETERMINED 'THE IBT 19596WAS THE FIRST CAR TO DERAIL AT THE #9 TRACK SWITCH AT THE FROG. THE CAUSE IS APPARENT WHEEL LIFT; HOWEVER THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF ANY DEFECTS THAT WOULD HAVE CAUSED THIS TYPE OF DERAILMENT. NO EXCEPTIONS TO THE TRACK, EQUIPMENT OR TRAIN HANDLING.'

04140-d-11-14-04-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
04140-d-11-14-04-URR.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
04140-d-11-14-04-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS PULLING A CUT OF 30 CARS (17X13) WITH THEIR CABOOSE NEXT TO LOCOMOTIVES (TONAGE APPROXIMATELY 2600 TONS) FROM #2 DEXTER ONTO THE PORT PERRY LEAD.  CREW WAS TO SWITCH OUT CARS INTO THE ORE YARD.  CREW WAS USING THE 105 CROSSOVER FOR THIS MOVE ONTO THE PORT PERRY LEAD.  AS TRAIN CREW TRAVELEDNORTH, OUT OVER THE PORT PERRY LEAD TOWARDS THE LONGWAY LEAD, THE ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TO SLOW ITS MOVEMENT DOWN.  MOVEMENT WAS NOT SLOWING DOWN AND ENGINEER REALIZED HE HAD NO WORKING TRAIN BRAKES.  THERE WAS A TRAIN CREW #76 CREW CONSISTING OF 13 CARS SITTING ON THE SHORTWAY AND LONGWAY SWITCH (CREW WAS SWITCHING OUT CARS FROM THE JOE WOLFE YARD).  ENGINEER OF ML #9C CREW COULD NOT STOP HIS CUT OF CARS AND HIS LEAD LOCOMOTIVE HIT THE CAR NEXT TO #76 CREW'S LOCOMOTIVES, DERAILING THE FIRST CAR NEXT TO ENGINE URR 3063 AND SECOND CAR FROM ENGINE MKC 4110 BOTH OF #76 CREW'S TRAIN AND LOCOMOTIVE #17 LEAD LOCOMOTIVE OF ML #9C CREW'S CONSIST.  THE DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED DUE TO THE LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER OF ML #9C CREW FAILED TO ASCERTAIN THAT THE CUT OF CARS HE WAS PULLING DID NOT HAVE TRAIN LINE CONTINUITY.  NO INJURIES REPORTED.  #9 CREW WAS D/A TESTED UNDER COMPANY POLICY.

660-d-11-24-04-VTR.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
660-d-11-24-04-VTR.Narrative: AMTRAK 291 DROPPED OFF THEIR PASSENGERS AT THE STATION AND THEN PROCEEDED INTO THE YARD TO WYE THE MAIN.  THEY PULLED THE TRAIN ONTO THE WYE AND STOPPED TO THROW THE OLD MAIN SWITCH BACK TO THE MAINLINE, THEN STARTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REST OF THE WYE WHEN THE LEAD WHEEL OF ENGINE 715 DROPPED IN BETWEEN THE RAILS.  THE ENGINEER FELT IT AND CAME TO A STOP IN ABOUT 60 FEET.  FOUND THE LEAD WHEEL OFTHE LEAD TRUCK ON GROUND AND THE OPPOSITE LEAD WHEEL OF THE SECOND TRUCK OFF AS WELL.

316444-d-11-15-04-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Automatic block or interlocking signal displaying a stop indication - failure to comply.*
316444-d-11-15-04-WC.Accident Cause: Automatic block or interlocking signal displaying a stop indication - failure to comply.*
316444-d-11-15-04-WC.Narrative: M34371-14 TRAVELING WEST ON MAIN 1 ON IHB, PASSED APPROACH SIGNAL AT CP ROSE.  AS M343 CONTINUED WEST THEY HAD STOP INDICATION AT CP NORPAUL.  AT SAME TIME, CP X502 PROCEEDING EAST ON IHB MAIN 1 HAD PERMISSIVE SIGNAL TO CROSS OVER FROM MAIN 1 TO MAIN 2 AT CP NORPAUL. AS CP X502 CROSSED OVER FROM MAIN  1 TO MAIN 2, M343 FAILED TO STOP AT SIGNAL DISPLAYING STOP INDICATION AND STRUCK CP X502'S SECONDUNIT AND FIRST CAR IN A RAKING COLLISION.  LEAD ENGINE ON M343 STRUCK AND DAMAGED SOO 6025 LOCOMOTIVE (LOST 1000 GALLONS FUEL) AND ALL WELLS ON 3 PACK TTRX 370052.  ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR ON M34371-14 WERE DISMISSED FROM SERVICE FOR FAILURE TO STOP AT SIGNAL DISPLAYING A STOP INDICATION.
